powergrid.model

Class Destination

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.model.Destination

  • public class Destination
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a destination by linking a location in the world to a name. This improves the readability and ease of access for end-users.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Destination(Point p, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new destination with the given name at the given position

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Returns whether this Destination is equal to another Object.

        This method returns true if the other Object is a Destination, the name given to that Destination is the same as the name given to this Destination, and the two Destination point to the same position.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - the Object to compare with
        Returns:
        whether this Destination is equal to another Object

        a String-representation of this Destination.

      • setupDestinationList

        public static void setupDestinationList()
        (re)collects the destination information and stores it for lookup.

        There is no need to call this method before looking up destinations, the getDestination() method automatically loads the destinationList when it hasn't been loaded yet.

        Calling this method will erase any custom destinations currently registered.

      • getDestination

        public static Destination getDestination(java.lang.String dest)
        Get the Destination corresponding to a given name.
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination name to look up.
        Returns:
        the Destination corresponding to the String, or null if no match was found

      • getDestinations

        public static Destination[] getDestinations()

      • getDestination

        public static Destination getDestination(Point p)
        checks if a destination is set for the given point.
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to look up
        Returns:
        the destination that maps to the given Point, or null if none exists

      • setCustomDestination

        public static void setCustomDestination(java.lang.String name,
                        Point destination)
        Assigns a custom binding for a specified String.

        after this method returns, calls to getDestination(name) will return the position specified by destination.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Destination
        destination - the location of the Destination

      • setCustomDestination

        public static void setCustomDestination(Destination dest)
